strategies.title: Punt FT% Build Guide - Variation #1
strategies.text:
**The Ultimate Punt FT% Strategy Guide for 2024-25**
            
            **Overview:**
            Punting ft is one of the most effective strategies 
            in category leagues. By completely ignoring ft, you can focus on dominating the remaining 
            8 categories while your opponents waste resources trying to be competitive in all 9.
            
            **Why Punt FT%?**
            Free throw percentage is concentrated among a small pool of players. By punting it, you gain access to elite players like Giannis, Gobert, and Simmons at a discount.
            
            **Core Build Philosophy:**
            This build focuses on maximizing value in categories that typically oppose ft. 
            You'll be targeting players who excel everywhere except ft, which often makes them 
            undervalued in standard drafts.
            
            **Draft Strategy by Round:**
            
            **Round 1-2: Elite Foundation**
            Target: Ben Simmons, Giannis Antetokounmpo
            These players provide elite production across multiple categories while being weak in ft.
            Their ft weakness actually becomes a strength in this build, as it doesn't hurt you 
            while providing elite value elsewhere.
            
            **Round 3-5: Core Contributors**
            Target: Nic Claxton, Rudy Gobert, Jakob Poeltl
            These players complement your elite picks perfectly. They maintain the punt while contributing 
            solid numbers in your target categories.
            
            **Round 6-9: Specialists**
            Look for players who excel in 1-2 categories while being particularly weak in ft.
            This is where you can find tremendous value as other managers avoid these "flawed" players.
            
            **Round 10+: Value Adds**
            Target: Jalen Duren, Isaiah Stewart, Kevon Looney
            Late-round players who fit the build and can provide streaming value or upside.
            
            **Categories You'll Dominate:**
            FG%, REB, BLK, STL, TO
            
            **Categories to Monitor:**
            PTS, AST, 3PM
            
            **Key Synergies:**
            Ben Simmons + Giannis Antetokounmpo: Elite combo that perfectly complements each other
Ben Simmons + Nic Claxton: Strong pairing with excellent category coverage
            
            **Common Mistakes to Avoid:**
            1. Don't accidentally draft good ft players out of habit
            2. Don't panic if you're last in ft - that's the plan!
            3. Don't trade for players who hurt your punt strategy
            4. Don't overlook specialists who are elite in your target categories
            
            **Waiver Wire Strategy:**
            Focus on streaming players who:
            - Are terrible at ft (this is good!)
            - Excel in your target categories
            - Have favorable matchups for counting stats
            - Get consistent minutes despite ft weakness
            
            **Trade Targets:**
            Players to acquire: Those with poor ft but elite elsewhere
            Players to trade away: Any accidental ft specialists you drafted
            
            **Success Metrics:**
            - Winning 6-3 or better weekly
            - Top 3 in your strong categories
            - Dead last in ft (this means it's working!)
            - Consistent week-to-week performance
            
            **Expert Tip:**
            Don't be afraid to be DEAD LAST in FT%. The worse you are, the better the strategy works!

            **Waiver Wire Strategy:**
            Focus on streaming players who:
            - Are terrible at to (this is good!)

            - Have favorable matchups for counting stats
            - Get consistent minutes despite to weakness
            
            **Trade Targets:**

            Players to trade away: Any accidental to specialists you drafted
            
            **Success Metrics:**

strategies.title: Punt TO% Build Guide - Variation #20
strategies.text:
**The Ultimate Punt TO% Strategy Guide for 2024-25**
            
            **Overview:**
            Punting to is one of the most effective strategies 
            in category leagues. By completely ignoring to, you can focus on dominating the remaining 
            8 categories while your opponents waste resources trying to be competitive in all 9.
            
            **Why Punt TO%?**
            Turnovers are a negative category. 'Punting' them means embracing high-usage players.
            
            **Core Build Philosophy:**
            This build focuses on maximizing value in categories that typically oppose to. 
            You'll be targeting players who excel everywhere except to, which often makes them 
            undervalued in standard drafts.
            
            **Draft Strategy by Round:**
            
            **Round 1-2: Elite Foundation**
            Target: James Harden, Russell Westbrook
            These players provide elite production across multiple categories while being weak in to.
            Their to weakness actually becomes a strength in this build, as it doesn't hurt you 
            while providing elite value elsewhere.
            
            **Round 3-5: Core Contributors**
            Target: Ben Simmons, LaMelo Ball, Julius Randle
            These players complement your elite picks perfectly. They maintain the punt while contributing 
            solid numbers in your target categories.
            
            **Round 6-9: Specialists**
            Look for players who excel in 1-2 categories while being particularly weak in to.
            This is where you can find tremendous value as other managers avoid these "flawed" players.
            
            **Round 10+: Value Adds**
            Target: Cade Cunningham, Darius Garland, Kyle Lowry
            Late-round players who fit the build and can provide streaming value or upside.
            
            **Categories You'll Dominate:**
            All positive categories
            
            **Categories to Monitor:**
            None - dominate everything!
            
            **Key Synergies:**
            James Harden + Russell Westbrook: Elite combo that perfectly complements each other
James Harden + Ben Simmons: Strong pairing with excellent category coverage
            
            **Common Mistakes to Avoid:**
            1. Don't accidentally draft good to players out of habit
            2. Don't panic if you're last in to - that's the plan!
            3. Don't trade for players who hurt your punt strategy
            4. Don't overlook specialists who are elite in your target categories
            
            **Waiver Wire Strategy:**
            Focus on streaming players who:
            - Are terrible at to (this is good!)
            - Excel in your target categories
            - Have favorable matchups for counting stats
            - Get consistent minutes despite to weakness
            
            **Trade Targets:**
            Players to acquire: Those with poor to but elite elsewhere
            Players to trade away: Any accidental to specialists you drafted
            
            **Success Metrics:**
            - Winning 6-3 or better weekly
            - Top 3 in your strong categories
            - Dead last in to (this means it's working!)
            - Consistent week-to-week performance
            
            **Expert Tip:**
            This is actually 'punt nothing' - embrace high usage players who produce everywhere.

strategies.title: Balanced Build Strategy - The Safe Approach #1
strategies.text:
**The Balanced Build: Competing in All Categories**
            
            **Philosophy:**
            The balanced build aims to be competitive in all 9 categories without punting any. 
            This strategy provides flexibility and consistency but requires careful roster management.
            
            **Core Principles:**
            1. Draft best player available early
            2. Address weaknesses in middle rounds
            3. Maintain category balance throughout
            4. Stay flexible for trades and adjustments
            
            **Target Players:**
            Round 1-2: Jayson Tatum, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
            Round 3-5: Evan Mobley, Scottie Barnes, Anthony Edwards
            Round 6+: Franz Wagner, Desmond Bane, Tyrese Maxey
            
            **Category Management:**
            - Monitor all 9 categories weekly
            - Use streaming spots to address weaknesses
            - Make trades to balance roster
            - Avoid category specialists who hurt balance
            
            **Advantages:**
            - Flexibility to adjust strategy mid-season
            - No automatic losses in any category
            - Easier to make trades
            - Less dependent on specific players
            
            **Challenges:**
            - Harder to dominate categories
            - Requires more active management
            - May lose to specialized builds
            
            **Success Tips:**
            Monitor category standings daily
- Use playoffs schedule as tiebreaker in draft
- Be ready to pivot if injuries strike

strategies.title: Guard-Heavy Build Strategy #1
strategies.text:
**The Guard-Heavy Build for 2024-25**
            
            **Core Concept:**
            Load up on elite guards early and often, dominating their typical categories 
            while finding value at other positions later.
            
            **Why Go Guard-Heavy?**
            Guards dominate assists, steals, threes, and free throw percentage. Loading up on them creates an insurmountable advantage in these categories.
            
            **Draft Strategy:**
            - Rounds 1-4: Target 3-4 elite guards
            - Rounds 5-8: Fill other positions with specialists
            - Rounds 9+: Handcuffs and upside plays
            
            **Target Players:**
            Tyrese Haliburton, Trae Young, LaMelo Ball, Stephen Curry
            
            **Categories to Dominate:**
            AST, STL, 3PM, FT%, PTS
            
            **Streaming Strategy:**
            Use your streaming spots for positions you're weak at, while your guard 
            core provides consistent production.

strategies.title: Keeper League Strategy Guide #1
strategies.text:
**Keeper League Strategy for 2024-25 and Beyond**
            
            **Long-Term Vision:**
            In keeper leagues, you're not just building for this year - you're constructing a dynasty.
            
            **Core Keeper Targets:**
            Anthony Edwards, Paolo Banchero, Franz Wagner, Jalen Green
            
            **Age vs Production Matrix:**
            - Under 23: High upside, accept current limitations
            - 23-26: Prime keeper territory 
            - 27-29: Win-now pieces
            - 30+: Trade for picks
            
            **Keeper Value Calculation:**
            
        Keeper Value = (Current Production × 0.4) + (Age Factor × 0.3) + (Upside × 0.3)
        
        Where:
        - Current Production = Fantasy ranking
        - Age Factor = (30 - Age) / 10
        - Upside = Projected improvement probability
        
            
            **Trade Strategy:**
            - Always consider keeper implications
            - Trade aging stars for young talent + picks
            - Package picks to move up in rookie drafts
            
            **This Year vs Future:**
            Balance competing now with building for the future. The sweet spot is having 
            2-3 young keepers while competing for a title.

            **This Year vs Future:**
            Balance competing now with building for the future. The sweet spot is having 
            2-3 young keepers while competing for a title.

strategies.title: Keeper League Strategy Guide #4
strategies.text:
**Keeper League Strategy for 2024-25 and Beyond**
            
            **Long-Term Vision:**
            In keeper leagues, you're not just building for this year - you're constructing a dynasty.
            
            **Core Keeper Targets:**
            Franz Wagner, Scottie Barnes, Paolo Banchero, Cade Cunningham
            
            **Age vs Production Matrix:**
            - Under 23: High upside, accept current limitations
            - 23-26: Prime keeper territory 
            - 27-29: Win-now pieces
            - 30+: Trade for picks
            
            **Keeper Value Calculation:**
            
        Keeper Value = (Current Production × 0.4) + (Age Factor × 0.3) + (Upside × 0.3)
        
        Where:
        - Current Production = Fantasy ranking
        - Age Factor = (30 - Age) / 10
        - Upside = Projected improvement probability
        
            
            **Trade Strategy:**
            - Always consider keeper implications
            - Trade aging stars for young talent + picks
            - Package picks to move up in rookie drafts
            
            **This Year vs Future:**
            Balance competing now with building for the future. The sweet spot is having 
            2-3 young keepers while competing for a title.

strategies.title: DFS Strategy: Maximizing Daily Fantasy Success #1
strategies.text:
**Daily Fantasy Basketball Strategy Guide**
            
            **Core DFS Principles:**
            1. Target pace-up spots
            2. Find value in injuries/rest
            3. Stack correlated players
            4. Differentiate in tournaments
            
            **Slate Analysis Approach:**
            - Check injury reports 30 min before lock
            - Identify games with highest totals
            - Find value plays under 20% ownership
            - Build multiple lineup variations
            
            **Cash Game Strategy:**
            - Floor over ceiling
            - Avoid risky plays
            - High minute players only
            - Chalk is ok
            
            **GPP Strategy:**
            - Embrace variance
            - Target low ownership
            - Stack teammates
            - Bet on blowouts
            
            **Bankroll Management:**
            - 80% cash games
            - 20% tournaments
            - Never risk more than 10% on one slate

strategies.title: Auction Draft Mastery Guide #1
strategies.text:
**Auction Draft Strategy for 2024-25**
            
            **Budget Allocation Models:**
            
            **Stars and Scrubs:**
            - 70% on 3 elite players
            - 20% on mid-tier
            - 10% on $1 players
            
            **Balanced Approach:**
            - 50% on 4 good players
            - 40% on 5 solid players  
            - 10% on value plays
            
            **Nomination Strategy:**
            - Nominate players you don't want early
            - Save targets for middle of draft
            - Create bidding wars on popular players
            
            **Price Enforcement:**
            - Know player values
            - Don't get attached
            - Be willing to walk away
            
            **End Game:**
            - Save $1 for each roster spot
            - Target upside in final rounds
            - Don't overpay for last starter
